channel.title: No-Code on AI Freedom Stack
channel.description: Recent content in No-Code on AI Freedom Stack

item.title: Lovable
item.description:
What is Lovable?

An AI-powered web app generator. Describe what you want — “a habit tracker with streaks, dark theme, user auth” — and it generates a full working app with React frontend, Supabase backend, and polished UI. You can iterate with follow-up prompts and deploy instantly.

Who is it for?

  • Best for: Solo builders validating ideas quickly, non-technical founders prototyping
  • Not for: Production apps (the code quality isn’t there yet) or developers who want full control
  • Solo builder score: ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5)

What does it cost?

Plan Price What You Get
Free $0 Limited generations
Starter $20/mo More generations, GitHub export
Pro $50/mo Priority, advanced features

Hidden costs: Apps are hosted on Lovable by default. Moving to your own hosting requires exporting code (which needs cleanup).

item.title: Make (formerly Integromat)
item.description:
What is Make?

A visual automation platform (formerly Integromat) that connects apps into automated workflows called “scenarios.” Drag-and-drop interface with powerful data transformation, routing, and error handling. More capable than Zapier for complex workflows, easier to start than n8n.

Who is it for?

  • Best for: Solo builders who want powerful automation without self-hosting or DevOps
  • Not for: People who only need 2-3 simple automations (Zapier is easier) or people who want full control (n8n)
  • Solo builder score: ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5)

What does it cost?

Plan Price What You Get
Free $0 1,000 ops/mo, 2 scenarios
Core $9/mo 10,000 ops/mo
Pro $16/mo Custom functions, priority

Hidden costs: Operations count up fast with complex workflows. One scenario run might use 10-50 operations.

item.title: n8n
item.description:
What is n8n?

A visual workflow automation platform. Connect triggers (new email, webhook, schedule) to actions (send message, update database, call API) using a drag-and-drop editor. Like Zapier or Make, but open-source and self-hostable. When the visual editor isn’t enough, drop into JavaScript or Python.

Who is it for?

  • Best for: Solo builders who want to automate repetitive tasks — content pipelines, data collection, notifications, API orchestration
  • Not for: People who need 2-3 simple automations (Zapier is easier for basic stuff)
  • Solo builder score: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5)

What does it cost?

Plan Price What You Get
Self-hosted $0 Unlimited everything
Cloud Starter $20/mo 2,500 executions
Cloud Pro $50/mo 10,000 executions

Hidden costs: Self-hosting needs a server ($5-10/mo VPS) and some DevOps knowledge. Cloud pricing scales with usage.

item.title: Bolt.new
item.description:
What is Bolt.new?

Bolt.new lets you describe a web application in plain English and builds it for you in the browser — frontend, backend, database, and deployment included. No terminal. No setup. You describe, it builds, you ship.

Who is it for?

  • Best for: Non-technical entrepreneurs who need MVPs, landing pages, or internal tools fast
  • Not for: Complex applications that need custom infrastructure or specific performance requirements
  • Solo builder score: ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5)

What does it cost?

Plan Price What You Get
Free $0 Limited generations per day
Pro $20/mo Unlimited generations, deployment

Free tier reality check: Enough to test it. You’ll need Pro to build anything real.
